required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Homologous Recombination Deficiency Status in Epithelial Ovarian Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Study on the Homologous Recombination Deficiency Status in Chinese Population With Epithelial Ovarian Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The homologous recombination deficiency (HRD) status in Chinese population with epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC) is little known. This study would recruit 1300 Chinese EOC patients. A multi-panel testing of 36 genes would be given for these patients in their peripheral blood and tumor tissues. These 36 genes include: BRCA1, BRCA2, ABRAXAS1(FAM175A）, ATM, ATR, BAP1, BARD1, BRIP1, C11ORF30（EMSY）, CDK12, CHEK1, CHEK2, FANCA, FANCC, FANCD2, FANCI, FANCL, MRE11A, NBN, PALB2, PPP2R2A, PTEN, RAD50, RAD51B, RAD51C, RAD51D, RAD54B, RAD54, MLH1, MSH2, MSH6, PMS2, EPCAM, STK11, TP53, CDH1. The study would select 150 patients with pathogenic or likely pathogenic mutations in BRCA1/2 and 150 patients without these mutations to further explore the HRD status. The HRD model is based on the loss of heterozygosity (LOH), telomere allele imbalance (TAI) and large-scale state transitions (LST). The mutated genes, HRD score model and their relationship with the prognosis, would provide a full description of for the Chinese EOC patients.

primary_outcome.description: Frequency of pathogenic or likely pathogenic mutations in a multi-panel genes

The HRD score for individual patient is a scale describing her HRD status. The score model is calculated by the analysis for three types of important molecular mechanism: loss of heterozygosity (LOH), telomere allele imbalance (TAI) and large-scale state transitions (LST)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of sensitivity to platinum-based chemotherapy
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity to platinum-based chemotherapy in recruited patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of sensitivity to poly-(ADP-ribose) polymerase inhibitors
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity to poly-(ADP-ribose) polymerase inhibitors in recruited patients

intervention.description: A multi-panel testing of 36 genes would be given for these patients in their peripheral blood and tumor tissues. These 36 genes include: BRCA1, BRCA2, ABRAXAS1(FAM175A）, ATM, ATR, BAP1, BARD1, BRIP1, C11ORF30（EMSY）, CDK12, CHEK1, CHEK2, FANCA, FANCC, FANCD2, FANCI, FANCL, MRE11A, NBN, PALB2, PPP2R2A, PTEN, RAD50, RAD51B, RAD51C, RAD51D, RAD54B, RAD54, MLH1, MSH2, MSH6, PMS2, EPCAM, STK11, TP53, CDH1. The study would select 150 patients with pathogenic or likely pathogenic mutations in BRCA1/2 and 150 patients without these mutations to further explore the HRD status.

biospec_descr.textblock: Samples from the patients' peripheral blood and tumor tissues.

study_pop.textblock: Chinese population with confirmed diagnosis of epithelial ovarian cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 18 years or older
- Pathological confirmation of epithelial ovarian cancer
- With available tumor tissues
- Given consents to participate the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not meeting all of the inclusion criteria
